timeline.author: JaideepPalit

timeline.bodyText:
Would it be possible to have narrower level of Exception.
Because Exception is very broad and include NullPointerException ... as well.
timeline.author: JaideepPalit

timeline.bodyText:
It would be good to have aSingleton here.
Same for other places like in testcases.
timeline.author: JaideepPalit

replies.bodyText:
I am doing it the way it is done in the rest of the code, except that I extracted the call new ThriftClients().makeHealthClient() into a separate function.
Would you like me to not do it in a separate method?
replies.author: neubs-bsi
JaideepPalit

replies.bodyText:
I was under the impression that this is not possible due to Thrift not being threadsafe.
Since the calls are made via Spring we can't control the threads. Hence the client could be corrupted.
Since I am not sure what exactly thrift does under the hood to its client in a thread I would opt for the safest option, which is to declare a new one for each thread.
replies.author: neubs-bsi

timeline.bodyText: It would be good to use CustomException class like Sw360Exception
timeline.author: JaideepPalit

replies.bodyText:
The Exception here is a formality that is needed because in this version of the spring boot actuator it does not take throwables in its exception status. The actual exception will unfortunately be wrapped within this exception already.
I don't think making this a custom exception adds information to the exception, which should be the goal of custom exceptions.
replies.author: neubs-bsi

timeline.message:
feat(rest): introduce health endpoint

Issue: #896

Include spring-boot-starter-actuator for a health endpoint

This introduces a possibility to get simple health
information by calling <rest-api-url>/health.

The configurations to application.yml to ensure all
health information is displayed.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

feat(rest): introduce db check as a health indicator.

Issue: #896

With a health indicator a rest state is introduced that has two
states that need to be checked.
The DB check ensures that a connection to the attachment database is
successfull. The Thrift Check is still in progress.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

Feat(thrift): Add health to thrift type definitions

Issue: #896

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

feat(thrift):Add handler and servlet of health to backend src

Issue: #896

This includes the database handler, which checks if all
necessary db's exist.

Tests for the handler are included

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

feat(rest): add new thrift client to health indicator

Issue: #896

This includes adding a make method to the thrift clients.
Now the rest health indicator can check the state of the
thrift health client.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

feat(thirft): Include html content for thrift.

Issue: #896

For the start return a basic welcome page.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

test(rest): Add tests for SW360RestHealthIndicator

Issue: #896

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

refactor(rest): resthealthindicator

Issue: #896

Superflous code was removed and simplified.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

fix(rest): Working rest health call

Issue: #896

The state in this commit represent a state in which a successful
up call can be made to the rest api and both the database and
the thrift are checked for health.

Tests are extended to test thrift health.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

fix(rest): Add dirty context to resource health indicator test

Issue: #896

Since per SpringBootTest class the context gets loaded only
once, the result of previous test somehow seem to modify the
application context. This solution was used:
https://stackoverflow.com/a/13288671/6466630

It is not a problem of the cache. Introducing a
NoOpCacheManager which should simply take cache items
without storing them, did not solve the problem.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

refactor(rest): Clean up application context.

Issue: #896

Added description for the context-path as a help for people
using the application yaml as a template for their own
SW360 instance.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

fix(thrift): make set unmodifiable

Issue: #896

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

fix(rest): make throwable local variable

Issue: #896

This avoids a potential memory leak, since field was
not emptied after a loop.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

refactor(rest): refactor check variables to be final static

Issue: #896

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

fix(rest): variables in health indicator now thread safe

Issue: #896

this also removes the lazy initialization.
Before the variables had a setter method which made them
non-thread-safe.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

refactor(rest): move management flag to test properties

Issue: #896

With this the tests can still be done to check if all the
information would be delivered if so desired, but they are
not in the main application.yaml where they might expose
additional security risks.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

refactor(rest): change throwable list to list of exceptions

Issue: #896

This way, there is no need to create a new exception containing
the throwable.

In a newer spring boot version it would be possible to directly
give throwables.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

fix(test): add missing db mock to failing rest health test

Issue: closes #896

due to existing test db, without a mock this test does not
return a status 503 since it finds a db.

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

Refactor(health): changes to include review comments

refactor(health): add proper indentation

refactor(rest): remove compile from actuator scope

refactor(health): change to immutableset

Refactor(health): exception was specified for db exists check

refactor(rest): delete left comments

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

Refactor(health): changes to include review comments

refactor(health): add proper indentation

refactor(rest): remove compile from actuator scope

refactor(health): change to immutableset

Refactor(health): exception was specified for db exists check

refactor(rest): delete left comments

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

doc(health): added documentation for health

Relates to #896

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>

doc(health): added documentation for health

Relates to #896

Signed-off-by: Stephanie Neubauer <Stephanie.Neubauer@bosch.io>
